text:
Nine persons, including a woman, were injured when militants triggered an IED blast at a busy market place in Meghalaya’s East Garo Hills district on Saturday, the police said.

The police evacuated the area as a precautionary measure, IGP (Operations) G.H.P. Raju said. The powerful improvised explosive device went off at around 12.45 p.m. at the weekly market destroying portions of a liquor shop and its adjacent rooms and injuring the nine persons, he said.

According to police, the Garo National Liberation Army (GNLA) militants planted the IED at the market.

The GNLA is an outlawed armed militant organisation active in the Garo Hills region since 2010 and is involved in kidnapping, extortion and killing of both civilians and security forces. — PTI
title: Nine injured in IED blast in Meghalaya
